creator: douglas.kramer@sun.com
text:
The http://ant.apache.org/manual/using.html#references section describes id:

 "The id attribute of the buildfile's elements can be used to refer to them."

It should also describe refid.

Because this description is missing, a search only finds "refid" in examples,
so its meaning can only be inferred.

What refid means has been a source of confusion, and it's frustrating 
not to be able to easily find a description of it.
(I was mistakenly assigning a property to it.)

Also, it would help if "id" and "refid" were more set off more prominently
(in a table or heading or bold), but it appears your format perhaps doesn't
allow for that?

In CVS HEAD, I have updated the References section of using.html to be a little
more elaborate concerning the id/refid attributes.

Thanks!
